bibl.title: A Further Note on Supplementum Hellenisticum 949: An Imitation by Vergil?
bibl.note: Suppl. Hell. 949, i, 12. That Vergil, Aen. 4, 138-9 knew and imitated this Greek line seems at least possible. It may be that Vergil is echoing three passages of Callimachus here. We thus may have more support for the suspicion of A.S. HOLLIS [Supplementum Hellenisticum 948-9: Callimachus, Hecale?, ZPE 100 (1994) pp. 17-21] that the Suppl. Hell. fragment comes from a commentary on a poem of Callimachus, perhaps the Hecale.
REED Joseph D., A Further Note on Supplementum Hellenisticum 949: An Imitation by Vergil?
